result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miclo R Sandoval

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miclo R Sandoval in court.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Miclo R Sandoval.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Miclo R Sandoval in court.  Attorney Tsz-King Tse in court for Miclo R Sandoval.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Case in court for deferred prosecution agreement hearing.
DPA was not completed and filed with the Court, defense requests additional time.
Case is adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement Hearing in Branch 13.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Miclo R Sandoval in court with attorney Tsz-King Tse.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Miclo R Sandoval appeared by video means with Attorney.
Defense counsel informed the Court that the defendant has a TAD evaluation scheduled for 7/25/2022 and requests a Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing date.
Court ordered case adjourned for DPA hearing in Branch 37All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Miclo R Sandoval in court with attorney Tsz-King Tse. Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Miclo R Sandoval appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. TAD evaluation to be scheduled.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 5-21-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Miclo R Sandoval in court with attorney Tsz-King Tse.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 048289,
Payable Number: 1007806,
Receipt Number: 22RP020436,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/19/2022@230P
